brief_summary.textblock:
-  Assess the attitudes and feelings of premenopausal Latin American women towards the
           risk of loss their fertility by adjuvant chemotherapy.

        -  Correlate the attitudes with other variables including age at diagnosis, already having
           children, number of children, level of instruction, marital status, frequency of
           menstrual cycle.

detailed_description.textblock:
Eligibility criteria:

        -  Latin American women with evidence of cancer diagnosis at premenopausal status

        -  Over 18 years

        -  Agree to sign the informed consent

        -  No evidence of infertility.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  women with breast cancer diagnosis in premenopausal

          -  over 18 years

          -  signed informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Evidence of infertility at diagnosis

study_pop.textblock: women with diagnosis of breast cancer in pre menopausal status

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Attitudes of Premenopausal Latin American Patients With Breast Cancer Towards the Risk of Loss Their Fertility by Chemotherapy

overall_official.affiliation: Grupo de Estudios Clínicos Oncológicos Peruano

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: Grupo de Estudios Clínicos Oncológicos Peruano

collaborator.agency: European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer - EORTC

lead_sponsor.agency: Grupo de Estudios Clínicos Oncológicos Peruano

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
